results.title: Rare Clinical Manifestation of Vasculitis.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: This case illustrates @DISEASE_Coronary_Aneurysm @DISEASE_MESH:D003323 @@@coronary involvement@@@, manifested as @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Vasospasm</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003329 @@@coronary spasm@@@ with favorable outcomes, in @DISEASE_Systemic_Vasculitis @DISEASE_MESH:D056647 @@@systemic vasculitis@@@.

results.title: Restenosis and clinical outcome in patients treated with amlodipine after angioplasty: results from the Coronary AngioPlasty Amlodipine REStenosis Study (CAPARES).
results.text_hl: BACKGROUND: @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@ has sustained vasodilatory effects and relieves @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Vasospasm</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003329 @@@coronary spasm@@@, which may reduce @CHEMICAL_Phenobarbital @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010634 @@@luminal@@@ loss and clinical complications after PTCA.

citations.NLM: Jørgensen B, Simonsen S, Endresen K, Forfang K, Vatne K, Hansen J, Webb J, Buller C, Goulet G, Erikssen J, Thaulow E. Restenosis and clinical outcome in patients treated with amlodipine after angioplasty: results from the Coronary AngioPlasty Amlodipine REStenosis Study (CAPARES). J Am Coll Cardiol. 2000 Mar 1;35(3):592-9. PMID: 10716459

results.title: Ultra-long acting calcium channel blockers may decrease accuracy of the acetylcholine provocation test.
results.text_hl: Multivariate logistic analysis showed that taking @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ until 2days before @CHEMICAL_Acetylcholine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000109 @@@acetylcholine@@@ provocation test was a significant inverse predictor for @CHEMICAL_Acetylcholine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000109 @@@acetylcholine@@@-provoked @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Vasospasm</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003329 @@@coronary spasm@@@ (odds ratio 0.327; 95% confidence interval 0.125-0.858, p=0.023).

citations.NLM: Kurabayashi M, Asano M, Shimura T, Suzuki H, Aoyagi H, Yamauchi Y, Okishige K, Ashikaga T, Isobe M. Ultra-long acting calcium channel blockers may decrease accuracy of the acetylcholine provocation test. Int J Cardiol. 2017 Jun 1;236():71-75. PMID: 28268085
citations.BibTeX: @article{28268085, title={Ultra-long acting calcium channel blockers may decrease accuracy of the acetylcholine provocation test.}, author={Kurabayashi M and Asano M and Shimura T and Suzuki H and Aoyagi H and Yamauchi Y and Okishige K and Ashikaga T and Isobe M}, journal={Int J Cardiol}, volume={236}, pages={71-75}}

results.title: [32-year-old patient with acute myocardial infarction possibly induced by the appetite suppressant sibutramine].
results.text_hl: Assuming that the @DISEASE_Acute_Coronary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D054058 @@@acute coronary syndrome@@@ had been induced by @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Vasospasm</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003329 @@@coronary spasms@@@, the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ was treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Ramipril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017257 @@@ramipril@@@.

citations.NLM: Pöss J, Böhm M, Link A. [32-year-old patient with acute myocardial infarction possibly induced by the appetite suppressant sibutramine]. Dtsch Med Wochenschr. 2010 May;135(19):965-8. PMID: 20446231
